articles.title: Jiri Prochazka seeks Alex Pereira Trilogy, Forest Dojo, Middleweight Drop and the Samurai Mindset
articles.description: Michael Bisping & Paul Felder sit down with Ji≈ô√≠ Proch√°zka to talk the Khalil Rountree war, how he flipped the tempo in Round 3, why a third fight with Alex Pereira ‚Äúmeans everything,‚Äù middleweight rumors, samurai mindset, forest-dojo training, action movies, and Christmas back home in the Czech Republic. Topics: pressure vs patience, handling eye pokes, self-belief, nutrition (yes: raw onion & garlic!), and what‚Äôs really next at light heavyweight. FULL PODCAST AT @bispingpodcast Chapters 00:00 Intro + time-zone mix-up 01:45 Watching the main event & Pereira‚Äôs ‚Äúfire‚Äù 03:40 Title picture & wanting Alex trilogy 04:30 Khalil fight: solving the counters 06:05 Coaches: ‚ÄúYou have to knock him out‚Äù 07:10 Raising pace to drain the ‚Äú100% responses‚Äù 08:20 Pressure lessons & starting earlier 09:35 Controlling the ‚Äúanimal‚Äù vs being too technical 11:00 Authenticity & being yourself as a fighter 12:40 Eye-poke talk, finishing the fight mentality 15:50 Martial arts movies (Bloodsport/Kickboxer/Never Back Down) 18:10 Acting/stunt work & keeping it real 19:25 What‚Äôs next: 205 belt before any drop 23:35 Middleweight hypothetical 24:50 Christmas in Czech Republic + forest dojo 26:35 How much is ‚Äútraditional gym‚Äù vs forest training 27:40 Self-belief as the core of everything 28:40 Diet: tuna, eggs‚Ä¶ and raw onion/garlic 31:05 Birthday ‚Äúparty‚Äù joke clarified & sign-off #bisping #ufc #mma #mixedmartialarts #michaelbisping #ufcnews #mmanews

articles.title: Would you Fix a Fight for $50,000?
articles.description: Would you fix a fight? Chael Sonnen dives deep into the question no one in combat sports wants to answer ‚Äî what happens when fight fixing meets MMA reality. In this powerful segment, Chael breaks down the real numbers behind fighter pay, risk, and betting odds ‚Äî and why taking a dive might not make as much sense as people think. From $50,000 bribes to losing your career overnight, Chael explains the logic (and illusion) behind fight-fixing rumors. He also shares a personal courtroom story that changed how he views truth, proof, and perception in the fight game ‚Äî and why fans should think twice before calling ‚Äúrigged.‚Äù üëä Chapters: 0:00 Would you fix a fight? 1:20 The real cost of throwing a fight 3:00 Why most fighters wouldn‚Äôt do it 6:00 Chael‚Äôs courtroom story 8:30 The gambling truth: when a bet looks suspicious 10:00 What ‚Äúproof‚Äù really means in MMA üî• If you love unfiltered fight talk and deep MMA analysis ‚Äî subscribe for more Chael Sonnen content every week. #ChaelSonnen #UFC #FightFixing #MMA #SportsBetting #UFCRumors #ChaelSonnenPodcast #UFCHighlights Guy Inc merch now available at https://BadGuyInc.com Click here to subscribe: https://bit.ly/3FrHIPK Follow me on IG: https://bit.ly/3HY7BIE Follow me on Twitter: https://bit.ly/3tvY5J7 All things UFC and MMA with the undefeated Bad Guy, Chael Sonnen. UFC Champions, Jon Jones, Conor McGregor, Colby Covington, Khamzat Chimaev, the MMA hour and commentary on the latest UFC news, UFC Champions in 2022, UFC knockouts and finishes.

After responding to claims made online, Chael explains the reality of sports betting inside combat sports, how misinformation spreads fast, and what fans don‚Äôt understand about submissions, chokes, and ‚Äúfixed fight‚Äù accusations. He also shares the behind-the-scenes truth on how the UFC could (and couldn‚Äôt) respond to betting irregularities, and why sometimes even the pros don‚Äôt know the full story until it‚Äôs too late. üëä Featuring: Chael‚Äôs take on the ‚Äúfight-fixing‚Äù allegations The FBI‚Äôs reported contact with the UFC Betting line movement and prop bets explained Why fans often misunderstand submissions What really happens when fighters ‚Äúquit‚Äù under pressure üî• If you love real fight talk without the drama ‚Äî subscribe for more Chael Sonnen analysis and MMA news updates. #ChaelSonnen #UFC #MMA #UFCHighlights #SportsBetting #FightFixing #UFCSuspension #UFCRumors #UFCPodcast Bad Guy Inc merch now available at https://BadGuyInc.com Click here to subscribe: https://bit.ly/3FrHIPK Follow me on IG: https://bit.ly/3HY7BIE Follow me on Twitter: https://bit.ly/3tvY5J7

articles.title: Creatine Islam! + Eye Pokes & Fixed Fights? | Good Guy / Bad Guy
articles.description: On this episode of Good Guy / Bad Guy‚Ä¶Back-to-back weekends of main event eye pokes and this time Tom Aspinall‚Äôs teammate was the culprit! Ante Delija is all the talk after he poked Waldo Cortes-Acosta in the eye and then immediately got knocked out after Cortes-Acosta decided to continue! Then, there‚Äôs a betting scandal in the UFC and DC had a front row seat to witness all the action. Hear what he says really happened when Isaac Dulgarian got submitted in the very first round. And, ESPN‚Äôs MMA Betting Guy Ian Parker joins the show to break down all the ins and outs of how the betting fallout went down! Plus, who has the greatest potential to be the next American born UFC Champion? ‚ÄúGable Steveson!‚Äù Find out which of the guys is making that statement. Finally, Islam Makhachev is less than two weeks away from fighting for the Welterweight title at UFC 322 and his new use of creatine is making headlines! articles.title: Chris Weidman tells INSANE STORY of brother punching his broken collarbone as a kid | Daniel Cormier
articles.description: In the most recent episode of The Daniel Cormier Show, Chris Weidman talks to DC about his upbringing and being bullied by his older brother constantly. Weidman also tells an INSANE STORY of being punched by his brother and his friends directly on his broken collarbone. Chris goes on to say the two have a great relationship through all those times, and that it built him into the fighter he became in the UFC. All lines provided by @hardrockbet Follow me on all social media platforms! articles.title: 'EYE POKE MADNESS AT UFC VEGAS!?!' | BISPING & DC INSTANT REACTION
articles.description: 'WE'VE NEVER SEEN THAT BEFORE!' We just walked out of the Apex and‚Ä¶ what a night. Daniel Cormier and I were still processing it in the car: one of the strangest eye-poke sequences we‚Äôve ever seen‚Äîstoppage signaled, replay checked, then a restart that flipped the entire fight on its head. Yes, people will compare it to last week‚Äôs Tom Aspinall vs Ciryl Gane situation, but the circumstances were very different. Don‚Äôt lump them together. Waldo Cortes-Acosta fought through limited vision, came back furious after the restart, and closed the show‚Äîinsane composure and power. Credit to the ref for using the replay signal decisively and getting it right under pressure. Main event? Steve Garcia looked sensational‚Äîeducated pressure, slick head movement, cage cutting, and serious pop. David Onama is tough to finish, and Garcia still found the answer. He even tossed a callout up the ladder. Whether that‚Äôs next or not, keep that name circled. Elsewhere: tight decision battles, a slick submission, and an undefeated prospect causing Twitter to melt down with ‚Äúfix‚Äù talk. I called the fight‚Äîdidn‚Äôt look like that to me. Sometimes a new, well-rounded guy just arrives. I grabbed a late flight so I can wake up at home instead of waking up‚Ä¶ rough. Quick debrief now, longer breakdown soon. Drop your thoughts below: Did the officials handle the eye-poke sequence perfectly? And who should Garcia fight next? üîí Become a Member for special Perks, Exclusive Content and ultra-exclusive Live Chats: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCDrG2_1TcVkXKXXsD6Kjwig/join ‚ñ∂Ô∏è Follow Michael on Social: https://www.instagram.com/mikebisping https://www.twitter.com/bisping https://www.facebook.com/mikethecountbisping ‚ñ∂Ô∏è Edited by John Brannigan: https://www.instagram.com/johnbranniganuk https://www.twitter.com/johnbranniganuk #bisping #ufc #mma #mixedmartialarts #michaelbisping #ufcnews #mmanews #ufcvegas110

articles.title: 5 Worst Fouls in UFC History! (Eye Pokes, Illegal Knees & More) | BISPING LIST
articles.description: All right, today Michael Bisping takes you through five of the worst fouls in UFC history ‚Äî from brutal eye pokes to submissions that went too far. This list includes everything from Yair Rodriguez vs Jeremy Stephens, Leon Edwards vs Belal Muhammad, Petr Yan vs Aljamain Sterling, Rousimar Palhares, and of course Jon Jones vs Matt Hamill ‚Äî the only ‚Äúloss‚Äù on Jones‚Äô record. Along the way, Bisping shares behind-the-scenes stories, including being cageside in Mexico when chaos broke out and bottles started flying, and gives his take on why the fighters who get fouled are often the ones fans turn on. üëâ What do you think is the worst foul in UFC history? Drop it in the comments. #UFC #MMA #UFC321
